abstract: Amtrak admits liability in two lawsuits seeking damages from Philadelphia derailment, which left eight people dead and over 200 injured; acknowledges that train was going faster than speed limit at time of crash; under 1997 reauthorization of Amtrak, company's liability for any single accident is capped at $200 million; claims are first of nearly two dozen filed in response to incident.
lead_paragraph: In a court filing that said the railway would not contest lawsuits related to the May 12 derailment of a passenger train, Amtrak also noted the train was speeding.

headline.main: Amtrak Will Not Fight Suits Filed in Wreck
headline.print_headline: Amtrak Won’t Fight Suits Filed in Wreck

snippet: In a court filing that said the railway would not contest lawsuits related to the May 12 derailment of a passenger train, Amtrak also noted the train was speeding.
